item.title: By: Livermore Revisted | GRAND MIGHTY
item.dc:creator: Livermore Revisted | GRAND MIGHTY
item.description: [...] though that day was particularly hot and sunny, I wanted to ride. For better or worse, I typically don’t let the weather stop me. My neighbor came through and was down to ride as well, because I doubt anyone else would have [...]

item.title: By: Ron
item.dc:creator: Ron
item.description: I use to work in the emergency at the local hospital (I will not even to bother mentioning where) and your experience is typical. The front desk is the worst. Only when you get an actual nurse assign to you will you see any progress to treat whatever injuries you sustained. The triage is very inconsistent.
item.content:encoded: I use to work in the emergency at the local hospital (I will not even to bother mentioning where) and your experience is typical. The front desk is the worst. Only when you get an actual nurse assign to you will you see any progress to treat whatever injuries you sustained. The triage is very inconsistent.

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description: thanks man. I just want to heal up and ride again
item.content:encoded: thanks man. I just want to heal up and ride again

item.title: By: Kent
item.dc:creator: Kent
item.description: don't worry bro, chicks dig scars. =P but on a serious note, good to see that you're still alive and well. like anything else, it COULD'VE been worse. i wish you the best for it and hope it heals within a reasonable amount of time if not soon. pretty gnarly picture btw. i was hesitant to check it out but i said "fck it", it's a blog. had to be something "good" (not really) that happened in there.
item.content:encoded: don’t worry bro, chicks dig scars. =P but on a serious note, good to see that you’re still alive and well. like anything else, it COULD’VE been worse. i wish you the best for it and hope it heals within a reasonable amount of time if not soon. pretty gnarly picture btw. i was hesitant to check it out but i said “fck it”, it’s a blog. had to be something “good” (not really) that happened in there.
